IDV, or Insured Declared Value, is the maximum sum insured that the insurance company will pay in case of a claim. It’s calculated based on the vehicle’s make, model, registration year, and current market value. It’s important to have a higher IDV to ensure you receive the full amount you need in the event of a total loss.

Given that it’s a new and valuable car, I strongly recommend a comprehensive policy that includes Zero Depreciation cover and Insured Declared Value (IDV). IDV ensures you receive the original invoice value in the event of a total loss. In the case of a total loss, this cover guarantees that the payout will match the original purchase price of the vehicle as per the invoice, rather than the depreciated current value, providing greater financial relief.
